poem:
### The Midnight Novelist

Between dusk and dawn, he crafts his tale,
children's dreams his only veil.
A nap to weave morning's seam,
evening unfurls his secret dream.
Envy whispers in the dark,
coins unseen leave their mark.
With a pen as life unpacks,
we're all rich in what we lack.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
